@HankMeyerNAPP They’ll probably build a monstrosity commission housing tower on it. They did the same thing next door to me in melbourne. The rezoned their own blocks to allow them to build up to four storeys. I sold my house before it was finished.

@HulbertOld @taipan168 @VicIndyMovement Right. So you understand that $580k per bed is about 4x the cost of what building normal social housing is in inner Melbourne. They could have built two towers to house 2,000+ persons in total with this money and all the services with it. Instead we have an empty facility

@DrCameronMurray Moreland Council, in Melbourne, has established a 'Moreland Affordable Housing Ltd' "charity" arm, to build "affordable housing" on Council-owned land. 
You just need a law firm like Maddocks to help with stuff like this.

Week ending 17 April 2022 
@SQMResearch

Final clearance rate was 46.2% from…

Melbourne final housing auction results. 
Week ending 17 April 2022 
@SQMResearch

Final clearance rate was 46.2% from 171 scheduled auctions.

Same week last year was 61.3% from 1,237 auctions.

This week sees 729 auctions for Melbourne (Anzac Day long wkd).
